title: Lesson 25
paragraph: This lesson covers music and harmony, including sound structures, rhythm, and tonality.

words.meaning: having a pleasant and tuneful sound
words.example: The song has a melodic piano accompaniment.

words.meaning: consisting of multiple independent melody lines
words.example: The choir performed a complex polyphonic piece.
The dissonant chords create tension in the composition.

words.meaning: relating to a symphony or orchestra
words.example: The symphonic arrangement included strings and brass.

words.meaning: relating to musical key or pitch
words.example: The piece is tonal, staying in C major throughout.
The drums create a steady rhythmic foundation.

words.meaning: relating to the ending sequence of chords in music
words.example: The cadential progression signals the end of the piece.

words.meaning: having a deep, rich, and full sound
